ygData.subject: Re: Skill Changes
ygData.msgSnippet: Hmm, hear this information from a GM? We ll surely need this information on the thorny armor then. ...
ygData.messageBody:
Hmm, hear this information from a GM? We'll surely
need this information on the thorny armor then.

--- David Edwards <Sun1@...> wrote:
> From: "David Edwards" <Sun1@...>
>
> Heh on Rubicite....Forget about it.
>
> In the works Rubicite will be takin away from all
> but true warrior classe.
> i.e. Warriors, Paladins, Shadowknights. Verant is
> tired of CT being camped
> so much and they think Rubicite is unbalancing the
> clasees. Heh after all
> it is plate and rogues and rangers not suppose to be
> able to wear plate.
>
> Aruyall
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Doug Sorensen <belgarth_of_surefall@...>
> To: <EQCheats@onelist.com>
> Sent: Tuesday, July 27, 1999 11:53 AM
> Subject: Re: [EQCheats] Skill Changes
>
>
> > From: Doug Sorensen
> <belgarth_of_surefall@...>
> >
> > I like to see my character advance, to wait 8 to
> 10
> > hours for a level is definately a bit much.
> Especially
> > since I can then only gain 26 hit points and 5 of
> each
> > skill.
> >
> > There are some people that do nothing other than
> play
> > Everquest, not surprising they are level 50. After
> I
> > would reach level 50 I would try another class.
> >
> > I think the game should have been designed with a
> > higher cap, say 100 and spread the skill points
> over
> > that range.
> >
> > Imagine people that can't play 20 hours a week,
> say 5
> > hours a week due to work, school and family
> > constraints. then you have to go 2 weeks at your
> same
> > level.
> >
> > Part of it goes along with not enjoying my ranger
> > anymore. I am level 26, near broke and half my
> armor
> > is banded because Rubicite is the next level since
> we
> > can't wear any normal plate. I will probably start
> a
> > cleric and see how it goes.
> >
> > Belgarth
> >
> > --- Lemac Justerian <lemac@...>
> wrote:
> > > From: "Lemac Justerian"
> <lemac@...>
> > >
> > > You think that 8-10 hours is "a bit much" to
> gain a
> > > level?? I play about 20
> > > hours a week (on average) and gain about 1-2
> levels,
> > > which is about right...
> > > if it was half that, then instead of being a
> level
> > > 22 now, I would probably
> > > already be up to 50!
> > >
> > > I kinda thought that most people level up pretty
> > > fast myself... hehe... Who
> > > would have thought that just 3 months into this
> > > online game we would have
> > > Level 50 players, and 4 months in, that we would
> > > have TONS of them, and many
> > > more level 40+ players!!
> > >
> > > I really didn't expect to reach level 50 for
> about a
> > > year (at 20 hrs a week
> > > that is about right too, it seems) so I think
> things
> > > are pretty good
> > > myself... I know many people are more interested
> in
> > > leveling up as fast as
> > > they can, but tell me, what do you do after you
> have
> > > reached level 50 and
> > > have played at that level for a month or more?
> I
> > > think I would get pretty
> > > bored with it...
> > > Lemac Justerian - High Elf Cleric on Karana
> server
> > > Proud member of Platinum Sphere Guild -
> > > www.platinumsphere.com
> >

> ----------------------------

> > If you join ONElist's FRIENDS & FAMILY program.
> For details, go to

> >
> >

> goto www.everquest.com
